javinator9889.localemanager.application

Class BaseApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Application
          • javinator9889.localemanager.application.BaseApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleApp

    public abstract class BaseApplication
extends android.app.Application
    Your application must inherits from this Application implementation or either override attachBaseContext(Context) and onConfigurationChanged(Configuration), declaring a static field of a LocaleManager instance.

    This base application allows your app to use a custom language (locale) without any troubles or even revert back to system default one. By using the proper Android methods, and managing Context objects, it is easy to implement a custom language without altering the normal application execution.

    • Method Detail

      • attachBaseContext

        protected void attachBaseContext(android.content.Context base)
        Set the base context for this ContextWrapper. All calls will then be delegated to the base context. Throws IllegalStateException if a base context has already been set.
        Overrides:
        attachBaseContext in class android.content.ContextWrapper
        Parameters:
        base - The new base context for this wrapper.

      • onConfigurationChanged

        public void onConfigurationChanged(android.content.res.Configuration newConfig)
        Called by the system when the device configuration changes while your component is running. Note that, unlike activities, other components are never restarted when a configuration changes: they must always deal with the results of the change, such as by re-retrieving resources.

        At the time that this function has been called, your Resources object will have been updated to return resource values matching the new configuration.

        For more information, read Handling Runtime Changes.

        Specified by:
        onConfigurationChanged in interface android.content.ComponentCallbacks
        Overrides:
        onConfigurationChanged in class android.app.Application
        Parameters:
        newConfig - The new device configuration.

      • getCustomSharedPreferences

        @Nullable
protected abstract android.content.SharedPreferences getCustomSharedPreferences(@NonNull
                                                                                          android.content.Context base)
        You must override this method for using a custom shared preferences with your locale instance. Notice that, at this point, the application is being created, so you must use the provided base for managing shared preferences and any other resources that depends on Context.

        You can safely return null if you are not using any custom shared preferences file, so LocaleManager will use the default one.

        Parameters:
        base - the base context obtained when just creating the application.
        Returns:
        SharedPreferences or null if using the default ones.
